txt.en: Defeat Frúzglob
Defeat Golugthrug
Defeat Lapus
Defeat Torúglup
Borndol once called the tower at Thangúlhad home. He was forced out before he could pack up his vast Black Speech poetry collection.
Ruithroval often loses competitions of speed and agility with the other drakes in Mirkwood and Dol Guldur. He stays and eats the feast while they race around the skies.
Thangúlhad is an advance position of which the Golden Host has managed to wrest control from the forces of Dol Guldur.
Azrí built many of the ballistae in use at Thangúlhad and has great respect for their power, though he has little respect for your aim.
Hokarul is on a mission to lay claim to the greatest pipe-weed and keep it all for himself...he has only recently heard of the Shire.
It takes a few large hits in the head before Grudom fully wakes up and is prepared to fight.
Frúzglob hates everything about siege-weaponry...give him a good sword and an enemy in front of him, and he is satisfied.
Golugthrug is one of the sneakier uruks in Mirkwood, stealth being his favourite weapon.
Lapus has spent many battles weaving through the lines to avoid the fire of catapults. He eagerly takes any chance he gets to destroy any of them.
Torúglup is a simple Warg, looking for nothing more than a good meal and a dry space to sleep at night.
Complete everything in the Protectors of Thangúlhad Skirmish
Defeat Borndol
Defeat Ruithroval
Defeat Azrí
Defeat Hokarul
Protectors of Thangúlhad
Defeat Grudom
